etymologies: early 18th century; earliest use found in William Derham (1657–1735), Church of England clergyman and natural philosopher. From ancient Greek πολύϕωνος having many tones + -ism

definitions: Multiplication of sounds or voices; an instance of this.

notes.text: In early use especially with reference to an echo.

definitions: The use of polyphony; polyphonic style or composition; an instance of this.
